This YSL Highlighter Gives My Skin a Natural-Looking Glow
description: I'm very regimented with my daily skincare routine - but there comes a time, whether it follows a night of too few hours of sleep or perhaps a drink (or two) too many - when the only way to achieve a glow is by faking one with beauty products. A good highlighter can lend a radiating effect without making its presence too obvious - there's nothing worse than glittering crow's feet. In fact, I've been looking for an option that's subtle enough to wear during the day. When a makeup artist friend mentioned that Yves Saint Laurent's Nu Halo Tint Liquid Highlighter ($30) was her go-to for creating natural-looking sheen, I obviously had to try it for myself. I decided to go with the Rosy-Quartz color. About the Yves Saint Laurent Nu Halo Tint Liquid Highlighter It's paraben-free, talc-free, BHT-free, EDTA-free, and mineral oil-free. It comes in three shades: Bronze, Rosy-Quartz, and Gold. Key ingredients include hydrating jasmine flower extract and vitamin E antioxidants. It's best for normal skin types and is built for 24-hour wear. What I Like About the Yves Saint Laurent Nu Halo Tint Liquid Highlighter The fine micro-pearls in this highlighter bounce light off the skin in a spectacularly subtle way. I've worn it with tinted moisturizer, a blush stick, and nothing else for a glowing, bare-faced, day-time look. In fact, it's so natural that I have to turn my head sometimes to catch the right angles to even see it. It blends in like a second skin and never looks caked on or greasy. I love how versatile it is, whether I'm using it as an eyeshadow base or even dabbing a couple of drops on my collarbone when I'm wearing a low-cut dress, it can go almost anywhere. I also have very dry, sensitive skin and it doesn't trigger any rash flare ups or breakouts when I use it. I appreciate that a little goes a long way. While $30 might seem expensive for a 0.5 oz tube of highlighter, I know I'll be able to use it for months. How to Use the Yves Saint Laurent Nu Halo Tint Liquid Highlighter You can apply a few drops to your nose, cheeks, forehead, and even eyelids for a subtle pop, or you can mix it with a tinted moisturizer for an all-over glow. What to Consider Before Trying the Yves Saint Laurent Nu Halo Tint Liquid Highlighter The formula's long-lasting component is nice in the sense that it stays put, but it also dries almost immediately, so you have to work quickly. If you don't apply it exactly where you intended or apply too much of it, it's going to stay there. The saving grace is that the formula is natural-looking, so mistakes aren't very noticeable. Where is the Yves Saint Laurent Nu Halo Tint Liquid Highlighter Available This liquid highlighter is available at Nordstrom and Yves Saint Laurent. Rating: Angela Elias (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping, where she reviews everything from beauty products to kitchen gadgets, curates can't-miss sales, and creates "best of" shopping roundups. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments. title: Merit’s Tinted Sunscreen Is So Good, It’s Replacing Our Usual Makeup
description: Finding the perfect skin tint takes a lot of trial and error. A good one should offer lightweight coverage and a natural finish that subtly enhances your skin, without sitting heavy or erasing your features. Add reliable SPF protection (which can complicate the texture of the formulation) to the list of requirements, and the search gets even more challenging. So when Merit Beauty unveiled The Uniform Tinted Mineral Sunscreen SPF 45, $38, a tinted mineral sunscreen that offers both sheer and buildable coverage, not to mention broad spectrum UV protection, we were quick to take notice. This new launch is a labor of love from the brand by all accounts. It took two years of development and more than 50 formulation attempts to get the consistency and finish just right. The sun protection comes from zinc oxide, a mineral filter that shields against UV rays by scattering and reflecting them away from the skin’s surface. Also featured in the ingredient lists are moisturizing plant-derived emollients (in place of heavy silicones) and ultra-fine natural powders for a weightless and even application. We got our hands on this highly anticipated launch and have been wearing it as our go-to SPF over the past month. Read ahead for our honest thoughts on why it deserves a top spot in your summer beauty routine. DashDividers_1_500x100 Jacqueline Kilikita, beauty director She tried: Merit The Uniform Tinted Mineral Sunscreen SPF 45, $38, in shade 24 “I don’t say this lightly: this is hands down the best tinted sunscreen I’ve ever tried. It’s replaced my foundation — and even my concealer. The texture is like a lightweight lotion, and whether I use my fingers or a brush, it melts into my skin easily, offering medium coverage that blurs dark circles and the marks left behind by breakouts. The finish sits in a cozy space between dewy and matte, so I don’t need to powder over the top, and the staying power is excellent. I can go a full day at work — in office air, no less — and come home to more or less immaculate coverage. “On my hand, shade 24 skews a little pink, so I was apprehensive it wouldn’t suit my green undertones. But once on my face, it blends seamlessly into my light olive complexion, giving it a more uniform appearance without erasing my features. If I wanted to wear this on its own without blush or bronzer, I absolutely could, and it wouldn’t look like I was wearing a mask. One thing to note: it’s important to use a dedicated sunscreen first. Yes, this contains SPF 45, but it’s well known that we rarely apply enough SPF makeup (a teaspoon or two finger-lengths for face and neck) to properly protect ourselves from UV damage. So I layer it over my trusty sunscreen — it’s like insurance for my skin.” DashDividers_1_500x100 Venus Wong, senior writer She tried: Merit The Uniform Tinted Mineral Sunscreen SPF 45, $38, in shade 22 “To me, the hallmark of a truly great sunscreen will always be whether I’m willing to wear it on an unbearably hot day. Anything that feels too heavy and icky breaks me out and will promptly get the boot. I took The Uniform out for a whirl on my recent travels around Asia, where temperatures hovered around 90°F with super high humidity, and I’m happy to report that it passed with flying colors. Out of all the sunscreens I’ve tried, this one has one of the most imperceptible textures. The carefully calibrated formula has definitely made a difference here; it feels very light and powdery and spreads evenly across the skin. There were days I almost forgot I’d put this on, if not for the flattering glow it imparts. For me, shade 22 provides the ideal level of coverage: just enough to neutralize redness and blur blemishes while maintaining a genuine skin finish. When it gets really hot this summer, I feel comfortable ditching all my other makeup and just wearing a layer of this tint, with my trusty Dr. Jart+ SPF stick as the final touch.” DashDividers_1_500x100 L’Oréal Blackett, Editor, Unbothered She tried: Merit The Uniform Tinted Mineral Sunscreen SPF 45, $38, in shades 10 and 12 “I’m not the easiest to please when it comes to skin tints with sunscreen.
